trans-unit.source: Provides session-state services for an application.
This class cannot be inherited.
SessionStateModule is ASP.NET's default session-state handler.
It writes session data to and retrieves it from the session-state store and raises the **Session_OnStart** and **Session_OnEnd** events.
For details about how to use ASP.NET session state to store and retrieve values for a user session, see [ASP.NET Session State Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
You can replace the SessionStateModule with a custom implementation of the <xref:System.Web.IHttpModule> interface that manages session state.
For an example of a custom session-state module, see the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateUtility> class overview.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateModule"></xref> class.
This constructor is not intended to be called from application code.
An <xref:System.Web.HttpApplication> object is created when an ASP.NET application is started.

The <xref:System.Web.HttpApplication> object calls the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateModule> constructor to create the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateModule> object for the application.
The <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateModule> is specified in the configuration for an application.
Executes final cleanup code before the <xref href="System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateModule"></xref> object is released from memory.
This method is not intended to be called from application code.
An <xref:System.Web.HttpApplication> object is created when an ASP.NET application is started.

The <xref:System.Web.HttpApplication> object creates and initializes the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateModule> object for the application and calls the Dispose method when the object is released.
The <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateModule> is specified in the configuration for an application.
Occurs when a session ends.
The End event is raised at the end of a request when the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.HttpSessionState.Abandon%2A> method has been called or when the session has expired.
A session expires when the number of minutes specified by the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.HttpSessionState.Timeout%2A> property passes without a request being made for the session.
The **Session_OnEnd** event is used to perform any cleanup work for a session such as disposing of resources used by the session.
You can specify a handler for the End event by adding a public subroutine named **Session_OnEnd** to the Global.asax file.

> [!NOTE] > The **Session_OnEnd** event is only supported when the session-state <xref:System.Web.SessionState.HttpSessionState.Mode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property value is <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateMode>, which is the default.

If the session-state <xref:System.Web.SessionState.HttpSessionState.Mode%2A> is set to <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateMode> or <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateMode>, then the **Session_OnEnd** event in the Global.asax file is ignored.

If the session state <xref:System.Web.SessionState.HttpSessionState.Mode%2A> property value is <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateMode>, then support for the **Session_OnEnd** event is determined by the custom session-state store provider.
Though the End event is public, you can only handle it by adding an event handler in the Global.asax file.
This restriction is implemented because <xref:System.Web.HttpApplication> instances are reused for performance.

When a session expires, only the **Session_OnEnd** event specified in the Global.asax file is executed, to prevent code from calling an End event handler associated with an <xref:System.Web.HttpApplication> instance that is currently in use.
For more information about the Global.asax file, see [Global.asax Syntax](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/9ade9d4d-4d52-4e88-af52-53a9ffa26582).
To be added.
Calls initialization code when a <xref href="System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateModule"></xref> object is created.
This method is not intended to be called from application code.
An <xref:System.Web.HttpApplication> is created when an ASP.NET application is started.
The <xref:System.Web.HttpApplication> object calls the Init method when it creates the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateModule> object for the application.
The <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateModule> class is specified in the configuration for an application.
The current application.

The <xref uid="langword_csharp_mode" name="mode" href=""></xref> attribute in the [sessionState Element (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/bda6fb8c-0076-43e3-9ce2-8cf1f8bdaa7d) configuration element is set to <xref href="System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateMode"></xref> or <xref href="System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateMode"></xref>, and the ASP.NET application has less than <xref href="System.Web.AspNetHostingPermissionLevel"></xref> trust.

The <xref uid="langword_csharp_mode" name="mode" href=""></xref> attribute in the [sessionState Element (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/bda6fb8c-0076-43e3-9ce2-8cf1f8bdaa7d) configuration element is set to <xref href="System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateMode"></xref> and the <xref uid="langword_csharp_customProvider" name="customProvider" href=""></xref> attribute is empty or does not exist.

-or- The <xref uid="langword_csharp_mode" name="mode" href=""></xref> attribute in the [sessionState Element (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/bda6fb8c-0076-43e3-9ce2-8cf1f8bdaa7d) configuration element is set to <xref href="System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateMode"></xref> and the provider identified by name in the <xref uid="langword_csharp_customProvider" name="customProvider" href=""></xref> attribute has not been added to the [providers Element for sessionState (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/219d6778-9fb8-48ac-810d-bec68cf7d6aa) sub-element.
Releases the session state for the specified <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext"></xref> for which to to release the session state.
Asynchronously releases the session state for the specified <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext"></xref> for which to to release the session state.
A <xref:System.Threading.Tasks.Task> for the asynchronous operation.
The event that occurs when a session is created.
The Start event is raised at the beginning of a request when a new session is started.
A new session is started if a request is made that does not contain a session identifier, the session identifier is invalid, or the session associated with a session identifier has expired.
The **Session_OnStart** event is used to perform any initialization work for a session such as setting up default values for session variables.
You can specify a handler for the Start event by adding a public subroutine named **Session_OnStart** to the Global.asax file.
For more information about the Global.asax file, see [Global.asax Syntax](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/9ade9d4d-4d52-4e88-af52-53a9ffa26582).
To be added.
